poem:
Title: Harbingers of Peace 

Newsprint grains spill klezmer beats,
fragmented tales under the mellow dawn.
Gaza, a stage of haunting retreats,
where time's brevity is mindlessly pawned. 

Clusters of years, rhythmically raw,
bounce, confused, on the page,
rooting for peace in a relentless draw,
amid chaos too deep for any sage. 

In the end, only hopeful words survive,
scribbled notes for a world yet to arrive.
